newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: APN to publish Ziff-Davis titles.
newsitem.headline: APN to publish Ziff-Davis titles.

text.p: Australian Provincial Newspapers Ltd (APN) said on Tuesday it has been given the licence to publish "PC Magazine" in Australia from the title owner U.S.-based computer magazine publisher Ziff-Davis Inc.

PC Magazine was previously published locally by Australian Consolidated Press, a unit of Kerry Packer's Publishing and Broadcasting Ltd (PBL) until last week when Ziff-Davis and ACP terminated their respective agreement.
APN said its magazine publishing unit APN Computing Group planned a period of co-branding with its leading publication Windows Sources Australia.
"Our acquisition of the PC Magazine licence also strengthens our intention to dominate the computer publication and online marketplace in Australia," APN said.
APN has the licence to publish other Ziff-Davies titles Windows Sources, Family PC and the online services ZDNet and Gamespot.

Ziff-Davies is a unit Japanese software group Softbank. APN is 49 percent owned by Irish media group Independent Newspapers Plc and the family interests of Irish businessman Tony O'Reilly. His son Cameron is the managing director of APN.
